channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Radiator dumped on the street, 5th October
item.description:
Radiator fly tipped on the street on Saturday 4 October. It appeared in the early hours of the morning. No building work or renovations going on in that property. From an unknown source.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Bromley Grove, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic is released too early from Southwood Rd under a green traffic light in direct conflict with traffic turning right at right angles from the A20 Sidcup Rd into Green Lane due to faulty traffic light sequence. The start of the green traffic light at Southwood Road is too early and dangerous in relation to the Sidcup Road A20 traffic .turning into Green Lane., 5th October
item.description:
Traffic is released too early from Southwood Rd under a green traffic light in direct conflict with traffic turning right at right angles from the A20 Sidcup Rd into Green Lane due to faulty traffic light sequence. item.title: Drug use in bin room, 5th October
item.description:
The Chaplin apartments bin room has been targeted by homeless individuals to smoke crack and now sleep in the whole year. Not only does our fire alarm go off middle of the night, but individuals are now targeting residents to let them in
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sylvester Path, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water bubbling up through pavement, 5th October
item.description:
Looks like a broken water pipe as was is bubbling up and running down the road. Hole water is currently bubbling up through is about 5cm in size
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Boutflower Road, Clapham Junction, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken guttering caused by overhanging tree, 5th October
item.description:
The guttering on Lauriston house is broken due to overhanging tree. I reported this both in writing and in person to housing officer many months back, before gutters had snapped. Now the tree has broken the guttering. Water comes directly through.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lauriston Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continuing bin problem on Grove Lane, 5th October
item.description:
This single household bin continues to be left on the street. Bin bags are fly tipped and eventually leave the bin overflowing on a regular basis. We have to fully sweep a significant amount of rubbish on this end of Grove Lane every day. Consider permanent removal of bin.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Grove Lane, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Usual problem with this young tree., 5th October
item.description:
This hawthorn tree has recently been released from its support prop. Recent high winds have rocked its roots again and it's leaning over.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, Beverley Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bin. No bin collection for over a week, 5th October
item.description:
The bins weren't collected this week and therefore the bins are overflowing. This was reported last week but only partial collections have happened, leaving this bin completely untouched. Due to an animal, nappies and rotten food are all over the floor.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clapton Terrace, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree causing subsidence, 5th October
item.description:
We moved into the property in August last year and noticed that doors on the front side of the house (facing the large street tree) would not close properly. The issue went away during the winter months but has returned this summer, along with several cracks opening up in the walls. The tree is approximately 5 metres from the front of our house. We are concerned that the roots of this council-owned tree may be causing ground movement and subsidence affecting our property.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dansington Road, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown Bushes, 5th October
item.description:
There’s a 10 meter long overgrown bush near the corner of Foxglove Path & Delisle Road (see on attached google earth photo). These bushes took over half of the footpath, so should be cut.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Foxglove Path, London
Report on FixMyStreet
